column3: (Just for the benefit of people finding this pull request in google searches:  Negative timestamps are not a sign of manipulation, nodes make no effort to avoid negative timestampsâ€” they just use their accurate times.  Ntimerolling by miners sometimes moves the time far ahead and then the next block gets the correct time at a time earlier than the prior one)\n
@gmaxwell they aren't usually a sign of manipulation, but they _could_ be a sign. This is correct, right? It's rare, admittedly, and might never have happened so far!\n

@rebroad It's not an interesting form of manipulation (someone could lie to slightly increase the difficulty by a about half a percent), but I wasn't taking issue with your comment.  There have been some people who saw the negative going timestamps and ran around claiming it was an attack, seems to be a common mistake people make in assuming that it won't happen absent an attack.  Logging it sound
ACK. I think it's still interesting to have these in debug.log, even if just as a way of keeping track of how far you are behind.\n
If you indent, can you please "always" use 4 spaces (4 spaces == 1 tab kind of)?\n
@Diapolo I thought 4 spaces was for inside functions/parenthesis, and 2 spaces is for lines that have been broken up over more than one line.\n
I'm not sure abot that, it just looked weird to me.\n
oooh.. it got merged. almost 3 months later. cool. thanks!\n
